page.title: 09Meltham Traditions
page.content: {Collop Monday}takes place the day before Pancake Tuesday.On this day children set off from their homes armed with paper bags,ready to hold the sweets that shopkeepers give them.This tridition is now only kept by one local shopkeeper Mrs. Woodhead who has happy memories of the custom when she was a young girl.The custom began originally when farmers used to give collops (slices) of bacon to children. {Sheep Fairs}:every September,the annual sheep fair is held in Meltham in the Co-operative Croft,at the time of the Meltham Feast.At one time there used to be stalls in the Market Place,and it was a holiday,but today it is remembered only by the sheep fair,the September holiday being taken at Honley Feast.
